They say beauty is in the eye of the beholder, and when I look at Richard Mille watches that look like this but cost from about $80,000 to around $2 million each, I realize that some beholders are insane. Anyway, this watch mimics one of the ugliest watches ever made, a Richard Mille RM-03, which I believe cost around $600,000.00 used. This watch is so hideous, I knew I had to own one. And since I don't have an extra half a million on me right now (temporary cash flow problem), this will have to do.  Considering how it looks like a pile of spare parts, it's solid. The case itself is steel, and the watch is quite heavy. Some of the complications are fake. For instance, the big date complication at 12:00 that says "28" will say "28" forever because it's not real. They've stuck a real but tiny date complication at 4:00; good luck clapping your eyes on it in that mess.  Same with the time: it's hard to read because the dial is so cluttered, just like in the haute horologie original. The chronograph function works, although you're not going to be able to get a correct minute count out of the tiny minute subdial (I guess you can pronounce "minute" either way here.) The main seconds hand is the chrono seconds hand, so that works for timing things under a minute.  As for comfort, the strap is actually pretty good, and the case back is curved, so it fits pretty well. And it's quartz, so it's going to tell accurate time.  Anyway, I've got no problem with the watch as a $40 quartz novelty watch. It's pretty cool, to be honest. But anyone who knows what a Richard Mille is will know instantly that this isn't one, unless you are wearing it in your Rolls Royce or on a private jet. No regular schmoe is wearing a $600,000 watch at Chipotle. And people who don't know what a Richard Mille is will likely think you are a very flamboyant person with questionable restraint in the arena of decorative arts. Take a moment and explain to them what the ultra rich waste their money on, and you can both have a laugh.

This watch is a chronograph so it will come in the box with no movement activated. You must press the upper right-hand button above the center Dial Crown (crown with 2 red stripes), to activate the seconds hand movement. All three time dials on the watch work, you must watch a quick video on YouTube on how to set chronographs because this watch does have the ability to set back to zero, which also allows the seconds hand to Quick sweep back to the12 position. I say this because unfortunately the box came with absolutely no directions or any information on how to contact the manufacturer. Pulling out the crown to the first stop allows you to change the date at the 4 position, pulling it out to the second position allows you to change the time just like any average quartz chronograph . The watch is an average build quality although it's a little more "blingie" than I expected as the photo of the watch I ordered is a little misleading, (looks darker in the Amazon photos). If you are wondering, be advised that these watches are Richard Mille knock-offs. An authentic Richard Mille chronograph starts off at about a $half a million dollars$$ :-) so have fun dazzling your friends at the club but you may want to leave it in the car when picking up sushi at your favorite truck stop at 3am in the morning LOL.

Well here's another review for me. I like writing em (good or not so good so people will know. I depend on reviews myself) & this one is a pretty good one. Here goes: It came in good condition (I ordered a prior watch that came broken so I found this one & it's way better) & boxed up pretty good not great but pretty good. It looks exactly like the picture. The strap is a little stiff @ the start but I worked w/it by gently bending it & molding it & conforming it to my wrist (& I have very small wrists so thank God the strap is long enough w/enough holes) to where it's a bit softer. Day by day it'll get better. Anyway no biggie I made it work & not enough to take away a star. The 2nd hand is in the little circle on the watch which is unique & I like. It's a great shade of brown of the strap & it's made really well (looks like it @ least & as they say time will tell) it's not flimsey or cheep looking either. The gold color sets it off. It's a nice watch. I'm glad I found it after a dissappointed broken one. The co says they check their watches before shipping em out & I'm glad of that (pretty sure that's true) all co.s should do that to be safe. So far it's keeping good time. It's comfortable too. I like it & it's a perfect size too. If u order it u should like it too. I would think @ least. Anyway it's a great watch (so far) for a great price. Good job guys
